name: unmanaged
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not controlled or organized, or not managed in an active way : No one is suggesting that unmanaged immigration is desirable, but policies need to be sympathetic to the reasons for people wanting to immigrate.be left unmanaged The growth of opioid addiction was left unmanaged for far too long. Unmanaged investment funds tend to follow the stock exchange as there is no fund manager actively adjusting the make-up of the portfolio.
More examplesFewer examplesUnmanaged growth will result in the city sprawling out and taking over greenfield sites.If left unmanaged, the giant hogweed would overrun the riverbanks. A managed forest can produce twice as much biomass as an unmanaged forest.

Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe a tracker (= a financial product that only follows the general level of particular shares), rather than an investment that is managed in an active way: One unmanaged fund is American Gas Index that invests in about 75 stocks from an index developed by the American Gas Association.
